result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin Gerald McCaa

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kevin Gerald McCaa in Court.  Attorney Joshua Miles Mathy in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Indigency hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Court held colloquy with Defendant. Due to financial and employment circumstances, Court ordered Defendant to report to the Public Defender's Office to be re-evaluated. Case adjourned for Status of Counsel / Indigency hearing, Branch 46. Clerk provided information to the Public Defender's Office. 
Status of Counsel hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 10:45 am. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated October 14, 2022; received and filed.

Defendant Kevin Gerald McCaa appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. Defendant is not SPD eligible and has not retained counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing to the trial court. 
Court orders defendant to continue to comply with Justice Point conditions. Court reminds defendant that the No Contact Order remains in effect.
Indigency hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated 09-13-2022; received and filed.

Defendant Kevin Gerald McCaa in court, appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no possession or use of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with XCM(9/4/01,DTB (8/19/83),JCM (12/22/98),RVM12/17/59),ZJM(4/4/07) and JCT(1/14/03).
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Kevin Gerald McCaa in court with Attorney William Hotchkiss.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/26/22 @ 1p
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 08/11/2022@1pm
